rename.from: ZAP API Python - Users component: get_user_by_id only returns the user's credentials.
rename.to: ZAP API Python - Users component: get_user_by_id only returns the user's credentials

body:
This looks like a python client issue (which is still our code;).
ZAP should be returning the full set of data: https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/v2.14.0/zap/src/main/java/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/users/UsersAPI.java#L434

I guess this is the relevant line?
https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-api-python/blob/0.2.0/src/zapv2/users.py#L43
Note that it is generated code, which could make the fix a bit more tricky..

The problem is that the API client implementation expects the response to be wrapped in an object, that happens for most of the responses but not this oneâ€¦ I guess we'll have to add something to the generator to handle this case differently (or change the response but that will break user's scripts).

Hello @psiinon and @thc202! 

Shouldn't user scripts be broken anymore? I say this because the scripts are taking values that are not in the object. For example the field **enabled**. Scripts are supposed to make use of these. So I think it would be fine if the generator side gets fixed.
I don't know, I say the latter because of what he said in his last comment. I assume you are referring to the user scripts that use this component or am I wrong? Sorry if I caused confusion.

Hello! Any news on this problem? Is it being treated?

Thanks in advance.

issue.title: Do not unwrap `get_user_by_id`'s response
issue.body:
Return the response directly as it's not wrapped in an object.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#8282.

issue.title: Allow to skip unwrap in Python API generator

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Exclude `users/getUserById` from the unwrap as it's not wrapped in an object.

Fix #8282.

body: Thank you all very much for fixing it!
This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
